intro: Hoya inflata, commonly known as the giant wax plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and clusters of waxy, star-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Hoya inflata is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
